business.headline: Sensex, Nifty close flat as falling rupee sparks concern on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 31.46 points to close at 85,106.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.20 points to end at 25,986.00.

Transferring money to family to save tax: Smart move or legal risk?On the surface, it looks like easy tax efficiency. But experts say that while transferring money within the family is legal, using it as a tax-saving tool is far more complicated and can even invite scrutiny if not handled correctly.

Is a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly salary in metro cities really enough? CA answersA high salary may create the impression of financial stability, but metro expenses tell a different story. A chartered accountant has explained how a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly income can shrink rapidly once daily costs and EMIs are taken into account.

Aequs IPO fully subscribed: Is it a buy or skip?Aequs IPO has seen full subscription within hours of opening, drawing considerable interest from retail investors. Experts discuss the company's prospects, valuation, and investor considerations.

Are gold and silver heading towards record highs this week?Gold and silver prices in India have climbed sharply as the rupee lost ground against the US dollar, with market observers attributing these patterns to global economic indicators and currency stress.
Will the EPS-95 minimum pension be raised from Rs 1,000 to Rs 7,500?As pensioner groups renew their demand for a hike, is the government finally considering raising the EPS-95 minimum pension?

If it was forged, why not tell us?: Man refutes insurer's fraud tag on sister's claimWhen a dangerous blood clot hospitalised Purvi Gupta, her family expected their insurer to stand by them. Instead, they recount months of bewildering paperwork, escalating confusion, and a sudden fraud tag they insist was never disclosed. This week's 'Claim Denied' story follows a family left stunned and fighting for answers.

Currency crisis explained: Why is Rupee falling constantlyA weaker rupee makes imports more expensive, increases inflation risks and raises costs for companies dependent on foreign goods, especially fuel and machinery.

December 15 ITR deadline: Do you need to pay the 3rd advance tax instalment?The deadline for the third advance tax instalment for FY26 is approaching. Here's what taxpayers need to know about who must pay, what counts as advance tax liability, and the consequences of missing this important date.

Meesho IPO retail portion fully subscribed. Check latest GMP, total subscriptionA fully subscribed retail book and a steady Rs 49 GMP have set strong early cues for Meesho's IPO, with eyes now on whether institutional demand will push valuations higher.

Rupee in freefall, slides past 90 against US dollar: What next?The key question now is whether the rupee stabilises or slides deeper. All eyes are on the RBI's policy signal, foreign flows, and any movement in the India–US trade talks.

Meesho IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check strength and key risksMeesho IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 5,421.20 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 38.29 crore shares worth Rs 4,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 10.55 crore shares worth Rs 1,171.20 crore.

Rupee hits all-time low, slips past 90 against US dollar for first timeThe rupee's slide to 90 heightens cost pressures for households and businesses, fuels import-driven inflation risks and leaves markets looking to the RBI for stronger support.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as rupee hits all-time lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 281.56 points to 84,856.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 105.10 points to 25,927.10 as of 9:40 am.

Delhi startup founder shuts down company after 'frivolous complaint' by clientAccording to its LinkedIn profile, Wherehouse was founded in 2021 as a supply chain intelligence company, helping brands move closer to their customers, enabling faster and more efficient deliveries, and driving business growth.

RBI MPC meet begins today: Will rate cuts finally return?In its October meeting, the MPC kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% for a fourth straight time. RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra had then said that inflation had moderated sharply, giving the committee confidence to maintain its stance.

EU to push ahead with plan to use Russia's frozen assets for Ukraine: ReportEU leaders agreed in October to meet Ukraine's "pressing financial needs" for the next two years but stopped short of endorsing a plan to use 140 billion euros ($162 billion) in frozen Russian sovereign assets in Europe as a loan for Kyiv, due to concerns raised by Belgium.

From ICICI and HDFC to SBI: Here's what 5 major banks are charging on personal loansBefore applying for a personal loan, it's worth knowing how much the leading banks are charging at the moment. Whether you prefer a private lender or a public-sector bank, understanding the latest interest rates can guide you towards a smarter borrowing decision.

Rent, cars, credit: CA explains why old financial wisdom no longer worksThe financial world young earners face today looks nothing like what their parents experienced. From renting to car ownership, an expert says that traditional advice no longer fits today's numbers, and sticking to it may do more harm than good.
Sensex closes 500 points lower, Nifty below 26,100; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 503.63 points to close at 85,138.27, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 143.55 points to end at 26,032.20.

entertainment.headline: Akshay Kumar to return to TV with Wheel of Fortune Indian version: Source Akshay Kumar is making a grand return to Indian television as the host of the Indian version of the iconic American game show Wheel of Fortune. The actor previously judged seasons of Khatron Ke Khiladi and Masterchef India.

Rashmika Mandanna calls for stricter cybercrime laws and tougher penalties Rashmika Mandanna shared her stern opinion regarding the problem of AI misuse and cybercrime in the country. She urged people to "choose responsibility over recklessness" and called for strict punishment for offenders.

Bigg Boss Kannada fame Gilli Nata's debut lead film Super Hit announced Popular Bigg Boss Kannada Season 12 contestant Gilli Nata leads the cast in Vijayanand's third directorial, Super Hit. The makers recently released the announcement teaser of the film.

BTS's Jin swaps cake for kindness with a birthday charity gift BTS member Jin has made a significant donation to the Busan Namgwang Social Welfare Society, contributing 100 million won prior to his birthday on December 4. The funds are designated to benefit underprivileged children and adolescents in Busan, focusing on educational scholarships and support initiatives for youth reaching adulthood.

Elvish Yadav calls himself husband material, says he has a softer side too Elvish Yadav confidently declares himself as 'husband material' while promoting his new sports drama Aukaat Ke Bahar, now streaming on Amazon MX Player. The series showcases his journey from influencer to actor.

Yami Gautam thanks fans for supporting Haq, reflects on cinema's changing landscape Yami Gautam wrote a heartfelt note thanking audiences for embracing her film Haq, reflecting on its journey amid today's intense review-driven cinema culture. Ahead of the release of her husband Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, she expressed gratitude, spoke about artistic validation, and reiterated her belief that "good cinema should win."

Shraddha Kapoor, Rahul Mody's mochi moment at Coffee Fest goes viral. Watch A candid moment between actress Shraddha Kapoor and screenwriter Rahul Mody at the Mumbai Coffee Festival has gone viral, prompting a flood of responses from fans and renewed discussion about Kapoor's upcoming film roles.

Jada Pinkett Smith sued for $3M by Will Smith's ex-associate Bilaal Salaam Jada Pinkett Smith faced legal action from Will Smith's former friend Bilaal Salaam, who alleged threats, retaliation, and reputational damage.

My brain splits into two: Priyanka Chopra on balancing roles as actor and producer Priyanka Chopra examines the difference in her jobs as an actor and a producer. While she will star in SS Rajamouli's Varanasi, her new co-production Born Hungry is out on OTT.

Kartik Aaryan shares fan-made video that hilariously leak the recipe behind his abs Kartik Aaryan delighted fans by reposting a hilarious video in which a fan jokingly "leaked" the 'recipe' behind his abs using a Kadi recipe audio over his shirtless scene. The actor's playful response came just as the title track of Tu Meri Main Tera released, boosting excitement for the film.

Ez-Ez: Diljit Dosanjh, Hanumankind's high-octane song in Dhurandhar. Watch video The new song 'Ez-Ez' from 'Dhurandhar', captures the fierce violence and raw emotions at the core of the spy-thriller, teasing high-octane combats, gunshots, and explosions as Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, and Arjun Rampal's characters wreak havoc.

Chandrachur Singh at Aligarh district magistrate office over ancestral haveli row Actor Chandrachur Singh, accompanied by his mother, approached the District Magistrate in Aligarh on Wednesday. He alleged illegal attempts by family members to take possession of his ancestral haveli and related properties.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 86: Thanuja's behaviour sparks chaos in ticket to finale race The ticket to finale race began with tension, chaos and unexpected emotional breakdowns, as strategy clashed with confusion and Thanuja's interruptions dominated the episode.

Indian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan recalls fatal accident: No one was helping us Indian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan discussed the serious road accident he experienced in May 2025, sharing details of the incident and his recovery process, including multiple surgeries for significant injuries.

Ahmed was scared to choreograph for Rangeela: Ramu told me 'You are nobody' Ahmed Khan recalled choreographing 'Rangeela' at just 19 years old in an exclusive interview. The film, starring Urmila Matondkar, Aamir Khan and Jackie Shroff, was re-released in theatres on November 28.

Director Mohan G seeks Chinmayi's clarification on apology over Draupadi 2 song row Director Mohan G has publicly called on singer Chinmayi Sripada to clarify her apology over her involvement in his film Draupadi 2, following social media backlash regarding her participation.

Pankaj Tripathi on daughter Aashi's acting debut: New generation is very sharp Actor Pankaj Tripathi reflected on watching his daughter Aashi perform in her first play. He also responded to a question about her possible future in acting.

Tara Sutaria opens up on privacy after confirming romance with Veer Pahariya Tara Sutaria recently said she is very protective of her personal life and shares what she's comfortable with. The admission came after she grabbed attention with her romantic photos and public appearances with 'Sky Force' actor Veer Pahariya.

Typhoon Family review: Jun-ho, Min-ha's chemistry rewards your patienceRelease Date:Sat Oct 11, 2025 Typhoon Family is a K-drama set against South Korea's 1997 financial crisis showcasing Lee Jun-ho and Kim Min-ha's chemistry. The series explores family, finance and love while rewarding viewers' patience with strong performances.

general news.headline: Virat Kohli roars again, hits back-to-back hundreds vs South AfricaIndia vs South Africa: Star India batter Virat Kohli extended his 50-over purple patch characteristically, scoring his 53rd ODI hundred and his second in succession against South Africa at the Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium in Raipur on Wednesday.
Centre removes mandatory pre-installation of Sanchar Saathi app after backlashGovernment removes mandatory pre-installation of Sanchar Saathi app for mobile manufacturers

India must break into pieces for Bangladesh's peace: Jamaat chief's son's bombshellThe provocative remarks were made by Bangladeshi Brigadier General (retd) Abdullahil Amaan Azmi, the son of former Jamaat-e-Islami chief Ghulam Azam, during an online discussion.

Calcutta High Court overturns own order scrapping 32,000 teachers' appointmentsSetting aside the single bench order, the Calcutta High Court division bench said it was not inclined to uphold the ruling as irregularities had not been proven in all the recruitments.

Raj Nidimoru's sister welcomes Samantha: We stand by them without hesitationActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru's wedding on December 1 in Coimbatore was followed by a warm family welcome, with Raj's sister sharing a heartfelt message and the first family portrait.

2nd ODI Live: KL Rahul key as India eye big finish in RaipurIndia vs South Africa 2nd ODI Live Score and Updates: India have lost three wickets in quick succession. KL Rahul holds the key as Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad exited after hundreds. Washington Sundar was run-out for 1 after facing 8 deliveries. Ravindra Jadeja has joined the stand-in captain in the middle in Raipur.

Congress has new Mani Shankar Aiyar: BJP jabs party over AI clip of PM selling teaNayak stoked a major political row after she shared an AI-generated video on X that depicted PM Modi serving tea at what looked like a red-carpet event.

Explained: Is Sanchar Saathi app mandatory or notThe Centre's push to make the Sanchar Saathi app mandatory triggered a swift political firestorm, forcing a dramatic U-turn within 48 hours amid Pegasus-style surveillance fears. So, what's the status now?

Assam doctor steps in after family claims woman is 'acting' despite critical stateThrough his post on X, Dr Priyam Bordoloi attempted to explain how family dismissal and medical negligence within households can endanger lives.

The soldier village of India: Where nearly every home has a 'jawan'Gahmar, India's largest village of soldiers, continues to inspire generations with its deep-rooted military heritage. Despite modern challenges, the community's commitment to defence service remains unwavering and a source of collective pride.

Flights hit across India as glitch impacts check-ins, chaos at Hyderabad airportA glitch in airport check-in systems caused widespread disruptions across India, leading to chaotic scenes at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport.

Asim Munir yearns for India war, Imran Khan wants to befriend BJP: Ex-PM's sisterIn an all-out attack on Pakistani army chief Asim Munir, Imran Khan's sister called him a radical Islamist and an Islamic conservative who yearned for a full-scale war with India.

Why senior pros are retiring from IPL ahead of 2026 mini auctionJP Duminy explained why senior pros like Glenn Maxwell and Faf du Plessis have decided to pull out of the IPL 2026 auction. The duo have been joined by the likes of Andre Russell and others.

Anti-drone guns to SWAT teams: Delhi fortified for Putin's visitRussian President Vladimir Putin's scheduled visit to Delhi has prompted significant security measures across the capital, with Indian and Russian agencies coordinating to ensure a secure environment. Authorities have introduced advanced surveillance systems and rapid response units, following recent security concerns in the city.

If it was forged, why not tell us?: Man refutes insurer's fraud tag on sister's claimWhen a dangerous blood clot hospitalised Purvi Gupta, her family expected their insurer to stand by them. Instead, they recount months of bewildering paperwork, escalating confusion, and a sudden fraud tag they insist was never disclosed. This week's 'Claim Denied' story follows a family left stunned and fighting for answers.

Delhi MCD bypolls: BJP dominates but loses 2 wards held previouslyThe MCD bypolls served as a key litmus test for the BJP, marking its first electoral challenge since the party stormed to power in the national capital after the Assembly elections in February.

Raccoon breaks into Virginia liquor shop, drinks whisky and passes out in bathroomThe mess initially looked like the result of a late-night thief, but a closer look pointed to the raccoon that had apparently crashed through a ceiling panel and helped itself to the bottom rack, where scotch and whisky were stored.

Live:Fake news is a threat to democracy, says Minister Ashwini VaishnawParliament Winter Session Live: Lok Sabha on Wednesday took up the Question Hour without disruptions for the first time in the ongoing Winter session, a day after the logjam over the opposition's demand for a discussion on SIR was resolved. Rajya Sabha is likely to initiate a privilege motion against Renuka Chaudhary over her recent remarks involving "dogs and barking," which the House views as a potential breach of parliamentary dignity and security norms. The Upper House is currently examining the matter, even as political strategy intensifies ahead of the next sitting. Leaders of the INDIA bloc are scheduled to meet tomorrow at 9.45 am in Parliament to plan their coordinated strategy on the floor of the House. Meanwhile, an all-party meeting has reached a consensus to hold a full-day debate on Vande Mataram on Tuesday, followed by discussions on poll reforms on December 9. Stay tuned with India Today for live updates.

Chinese humanoid robot spying near India? Unverified clip sparks chatterA video purportedly showing a humanoid robot near the India-China border has gone viral. Claims of the robot patrolling or spying have surfaced amid a diplomatic thaw between New Delhi and Beijing for the first time since the Galwan Valley clash in 2020. The clip couldn't be verified by India Today Digital.

What is S-500 missile system India is eyeing after Op Sindoor successPutin India visit: The S-400 missile system brought Pakistan to its knees during India's Operation Sindoor. Now, with Russian President Putin to arrive in India on Thursday, India is eyeing its stronger and smarter brother - the S-500 air shield.

Bollywood in a spot: Gone are the days, or can Hindi cinema bounce back?Bollywood seems to be in crisis. Mumbai Cinema is at the crossroads of big-budget flops, star power and southern challenge. What is the way for the Hindi film industry to recover?

Congress's Renuka Chowdhury asked about dog in Parliament row. Her bizarre replyRenuka Chowdhury, who sparked a row by bringing a dog to Parliament, brushed off questions about a possible privilege motion with a bizzare response before walking away.

Threatened, pressured: Mahua Moitra says Odisha cops threw out Bengali workersThe Trinamool Congress had earlier accused the Odisha Police of arbitrary detention and harassment of Bengali-speaking migrant workers. State authorities have, however, dismissed the claims.

Congress posts AI video of PM selling tea at red-carpet event, triggers rowThe BJP was quick to condemn the AI-generated video, accusing the Congress of "abusing" Prime Minister Narendra Modi yet again.

IMDb announces the top 10 most popular Indian stars of 2025IMDb has shared its list of the Top 10 Most Popular Indian Stars of 2025, highlighting the actors who consistently dominated audience interest throughout the year. The rankings are determined by the actual page views of IMDb's more than 250 million monthly global visitors, making the list a reflection of organic audience curiosity and star power.

Rashmika Mandanna calls for stricter cybercrime laws and tougher penaltiesRashmika Mandanna shared her stern opinion regarding the problem of AI misuse and cybercrime in the country. She urged people to "choose responsibility over recklessness" and called for strict punishment for offenders.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli Hits 53rd ODI Century vs South Africa; Ruturaj Gaikwad Slams Maiden Ton In this Special Report, India Today's Consulting Editor (Sports) Nikhil Naaz reports on Virat Kohli's record-breaking 53rd ODI century against South Africa in Raipur. Kohli, scoring his 84th international hundred, built a match-winning partnership with Ruturaj Gaikwad, who registered his maiden ODI ton. Naaz highlights Kohli's 'unbelievable' consistency and addresses speculations about his Test return. Quoting Kohli, Naaz confirms the star batter's decision to stick to one format: 'I'm focusing on the ODI format, that's the only format that I continue to play.' The report analyzes how the duo rescued India from a precarious 60 for 2 to dominate the 2nd ODI.

Virat Kohli roars again, hits back-to-back hundreds vs South Africa India vs South Africa: Star India batter Virat Kohli extended his 50-over purple patch characteristically, scoring his 53rd ODI hundred and his second in succession against South Africa at the Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium in Raipur on Wednesday.

Ruturaj converts rare opportunity, smashes maiden ODI hundred in Raipur India vs South Africa: Ruturaj Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred on Wednesday, bringing up the landmark in just 77 deliveries. The Chennai Super Kings captain stitched a 190-plus partnership with Virat Kohli in Raipur.

Jarmanpreet Singh, Navneet Kaur to lead SG Pipers in HIL season 2 SG Pipers have revealed their captaincy choices for Season 2 of the Hockey India League, appointing Jarmanpreet Singh to helm the men's squad and retaining Navneet Kaur for the women's side. Australians Ky Willott and Kaitlin Nobbs step in as vice-captains, as both teams look to rebound from last year's campaigns.

The Coaching Quandary: Why Indian Hockey keeps failing the long-term vision test Indian hockey still seems to be stuck in terms of fixing their long-term vision when it comes to coaches. With Harendra Singh leaving the Women's team post, Hockey India are set to make an interesting call and go for former coach Sjoerd Marijne.

NZ vs WI, 1st Test: Jacob Duffy takes five as New Zealand seize control on Day 2 Jacob Duffy took his maiden five-wicket haul to put New Zealand in control of the first Test against West Indies. His spell helped bundle out the visitors for 167 as the Kiwis finished the day with a lead of 96 runs.

Why senior pros are retiring from IPL ahead of 2026 mini auction JP Duminy explained why senior pros like Glenn Maxwell and Faf du Plessis have decided to pull out of the IPL 2026 auction. The duo have been joined by the likes of Andre Russell and others.

Cummins fit for Gabba Test? Steve Smith tight-lipped on Australia's playing XI Ashes: Pat Cummins may return as Australia's captain for the second Test against England, with stand-in skipper Steve Smith indicating that the fast bowler has a genuine chance of featuring in the pink-ball match.

Virat Kohli leapfrogs Gill in ICC ODI rankings, Rohit maintains top spot Virat Kohli went past India captain Shubman Gill in the latest ICC ODI rankings while Rohit Sharma maintained his grip at the top. Kohli scored a brilliant 135 against South Africa in Ranchi in his return game.

Watch: KL Rahul left frustrated as India lose 20th straight ODI toss in Raipur India captain KL Rahul was left gutted as the Indian team lost their 20th straight toss in ODIs with South Africa getting the luck of the coin in Raipur.

Why senior pros are retiring from IPL ahead of 2026 mini auction JP Duminy explained why senior pros like Glenn Maxwell and Faf du Plessis have decided to pull out of the IPL 2026 auction. The duo have been joined by the likes of Andre Russell and others.

Cummins fit for Gabba Test? Steve Smith tight-lipped on Australia's playing XI Ashes: Pat Cummins may return as Australia's captain for the second Test against England, with stand-in skipper Steve Smith indicating that the fast bowler has a genuine chance of featuring in the pink-ball match.

Virat Kohli leapfrogs Gill in ICC ODI rankings, Rohit maintains top spot Virat Kohli went past India captain Shubman Gill in the latest ICC ODI rankings while Rohit Sharma maintained his grip at the top. Kohli scored a brilliant 135 against South Africa in Ranchi in his return game.

Watch: KL Rahul left frustrated as India lose 20th straight ODI toss in Raipur India captain KL Rahul was left gutted as the Indian team lost their 20th straight toss in ODIs with South Africa getting the luck of the coin in Raipur.

Harshit Rana reprimanded for aggressive send-off to Dewald Brevis in RanchiHarshit Rana has been reprimanded for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi on Sunday. Rana admitted to the offence, which involved a gesture after dismissing Dewald Brevis in the 22nd over of South Africa's innings.

How an IPL- styled league is bringing about a revolution in Pickleball in India?Pickleball as a sport is capturing the imagination of many people in India, and to capitalise on that, a new Indian Pickleball League was inaugurated in New Delhi and one hopes that the league taps into the exponential growth of Pickleball in India.

Shubman Gill's injury rehab timeline: Batter set for final test on December 5India opener Shubman Gill is on track with his neck injury recovery ahead of the South Africa T20I series. His final fitness clearance hinges on a Return to Play match scheduled for December 5.

Kohli won't come back to Tests now: Kaif rules out retirement U-turn for starFormer cricketer Mohammed Kaif feels that Virat Kohli will never make a retirement U-turn in Test cricket. There were rumours that BCCI were thinking about bringing back Kohli into the long format after recent results.

How Boland bounced back from a horrific 1st innings in Perth? Pacer revealsScott Boland bounced back from a tough first innings in the first Ashes Test against England. He went on to pick a four-wicket haul in the second innings, playing a key role in Australia's win.

SA came to India with purpose and belief, not just to compete: Tabraiz ShamsiTabraiz Shamsi feels South Africa's strong preparation and collective belief proved crucial in whitewashing India 2-0. He credited the team for overcoming previous challenges and scripting history.

2nd ODI Live: India lose quick wickets after Kohli, Ruturaj hundredsIndia vs South Africa 2nd ODI Live Score and Updates: India have lost three wickets in quick succession. KL Rahul holds the key as Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad exited after hundreds. Washington Sundar was run-out for 1 after facing 8 deliveries. Ravindra Jadeja has joined the stand-in captain in the middle in Raipur.

Watch: Virat Kohli unleashes six barrage in Raipur to thrill fans ahead of 2nd ODIVirat Kohli went on a six-hitting rampage to thrill the fans in Raipur on the eve of the second ODI between India and South Africa. Kohli and the Indian team put in the final touches as they aim to seal the series with a win on Wednesday, December 3.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in World Cup 2027? Hope they don't make it, jokes GurbazAfghanistan wicketkeeper Rahmanullah Gurbaz said that no one can say that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli shouldn't be in the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Gurbaz, however, joked that he won't mind having to face the duo during the ICC event.

Serena Williams denies tennis return despite re-entering anti-doping test poolSerena Williams put to rest mounting speculation about her tennis future after confirming she has no plans to return, even as her re-entry into the International Tennis Integrity Agency anti-doping pool stoked widespread comeback rumors.

Haaland creates history as Manchester City down Fulham in goal festManchester City extended their winning streak over Fulham with a 5–4 victory, as Erling Haaland became the fastest player to reach 100 Premier League goals. Newcastle and Tottenham played out a 2–2 draw, with Cristian Romero scoring twice for Spurs, including a stoppage-time equaliser.

India's next in line: Jaiswal, Ruturaj must prove they belong nowTwo young batters, two crossroads. Jaiswal battles a left-arm pace weakness, Gaikwad seeks validation in his best format. South Africa will reveal whether they're stopgaps—or pillars of India's ODI future.

Rejuvenated Rohit, Virat look to seal series for India in RaipurIND vs SA: India arrive in Raipur having won a tense opening fixture in Ranchi. Rejuvenated by the presence of Rohit and Kohli, the hosts will look to seal the series in the second ODI.

Junior Men's Hockey World Cup: India beat Switzerland 5-0 to reach quarterfinalsManmeet Singh scored twice on his birthday as India sealed a dominant 5-0 win over Switzerland, completing an unbeaten pool stage and securing a place in the quarterfinals of the FIH Men's Junior Hockey World Cup.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma still going as hard as 28–30-year-olds, says Madan LalMadan Lal says Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are playing with the freshness and intensity of 28–30-year-olds, insisting the senior duo should decide their own ODI future as they continue to drive India's performances.

No pressure of paycheque but motivated to do well for UP Warriorz in WPL: DeeptiAfter being bought back by the UP Warriorz for Rs 3.2 crore ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League, star India all-rounder Deepti Sharma said the price tag brings her no pressure and, if anything, only pushes her to perform better in the fourth edition of the tournament.

Ben Stokes plays down England's dismal Gabba record ahead of pink-ball TestEngland captain Ben Stokes said his side carries no fear of the Gabba despite the venue's daunting Ashes history. Stokes said the current England squad has the confidence and edge to challenge Australia in their own backyard.

Virat Kohli set to play Vijay Hazare Trophy after 15 yearsStar India batter Virat Kohli on Tuesday informed the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) that he will be available for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy, marking his first appearance in the domestic one-day competition since 2010.

In-form Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma train hard in nets ahead of Ranchi ODIVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma trained hard during an intense net session, taking on throw-down specialists in tandem ahead of Wednesday's second ODI against South Africa.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
